pageContent: LOGINLOGOUTHELPPrinter FriendlyPageEarthfiles, news category.Share:DiggFacebookStumbleUpon More 2003 Crop Formations in Germany© 2003 by Linda Moulton Howe May 20, 2003 Isle of Rugen, Germany -Invisiblecircle.de is reporting five crop formations in Germany as of May 18,2003. All five are on the Isle of Rugen in the Baltic Sea at the far most easterncorner of Germany. In 2002, most of Germany's formations were also on the Isleof Rugen which is an island 35 miles long and 25 miles wide with 400-foot-highchalk cliffs and covered with ancient burial mounds and stone circles.Isle of Rugen in the Baltic Sea at the far most eastern cornerof Germany, 35 miles long and 25 miles wide.All five formations have been in yellow flowering oilseed rape such as the fieldbelow near the village of Scharpitz discovered on May 10. In fact, four of thefive formations so far have been near Scharpitz; the first on May 1 wasdiscovered near Altefahr. As in previous years of formations on the Isle ofRugen, the patterns in 2003 are variations on circles, corridors and concentricrings.Two crop patterns in foreground were discovered on May 10, 2003,in yellow flowering oilseed rape near the village of Scharpitz on Germany'sIsle of Rugen. Photograph © 2003 by Frank Laumen.

Corridor and circle point north.Diagram © 2003 by Jan Schwochow.Closer aerial over the May 10, 2003 patterns near Scharpitz,Isle of Rugen. Scharpitz.
